There was a very interesting description in Professor Uchida's "The Theory of Mourning in the Street". When discussing the base problem in Okinawa, we must know what American West Pacific strategy is. A strategy based base deployment plan was created, and it has historically fluctuated greatly in the world. However, regarding Okinawa, geopolitical changes have not changed the importance in military strategy.

(Continued) If there are military bases that do not change their importance despite changes in geopolitical conditions, it means "a base unrelated to geopolitical change", that is, , Neither good base "other than that. Logically it's like this.

'We want the purchasing power of citizens to increase: 120 € net / month + for people who work' @PSofficiel #MoreFortsEnsemble
'We are here to defend the indexation of citizens' income and social security' @PSofficiel #MoreFortsEnsemble
'We are for a Government as far left as possible, the most progressive possible' @PSofficiel #MoreFortsEnsemble
'Removal of the index = loss of 350 € / year and 3 months of income after 5 years. That's what awaits if there was a government of the rights'
'The return to economic growth must benefit everyone, especially the most disadvantaged' @PSofficiel #MoreFortsEnsemble
'We need the left at the Gvt. There were Communists in Parliament, it did not stop Gvt Martens-Gol with the jump of 3 indexes'
'We do not vote for or against Europe. We need Europe. But we need another Europe, which accompanies and helps the citizens'
